TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SoapSchemaMember extends System.Object

remarks.para: The class is used by the Wsdl.exe tool while generating client proxy classes or abstract server classes from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document. Instead of using this class directly, use Wsdl.exe.

The class has properties that correspond to the name and type attributes of a WSDL part element. The class is used only when a WSDL document specifies SOAP encoding, as described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

summary.para: Represents certain attributes of a XSD <part> element in a WSDL document for generating classes from the document.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'string'

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the XML name attribute of the XML element <wsdl:part>. For more information about the element, see http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl.

The class is used by the Wsdl.exe tool while generating classes from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document that specifies SOAP encoding. Instead of using this class directly, use Wsdl.exe.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that corresponds to the name attribute of the WSDL part element.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName'

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the XML type attribute of the XML element <wsdl:part>. For more information about the element, see http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl.

The class is used by the Wsdl.exe tool while generating classes from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document that specifies SOAP encoding. Instead of using this class directly, use Wsdl.exe.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that corresponds to the type attribute of the WSDL part element.
